DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study : 1 . To evaluate whether 550 mg naproxen sodium reduces pain score IUD insertion 0-10cm visual analogue scale compare placebo ( primary outcome ) . 2 . To evaluate whether 550 mg naproxen sodium reduces pain score tenaculum placement , uterine sound post-procedurally 0-10 cm visual analog scale compare placebo ( secondary outcome ) . 3 . To establish prophylactic naproxen sodium acceptable routine use prior IUD insertion . Hypothesis : The administration naproxen sodium , 550mg orally , 1 hour prior IUD insertion lead reduction pain score associate IUD insertion compare placebo .
DOC.brief_title: Naproxen Pain Control With Intrauterine Device Insertion
DOC.criteria: Age 18 year old Premenopausal Presenting insertion IUD type ( i.e . Mirena , Paragard , Skyla ) Englishspeaking nonEnglish speaking appropriate translator available Currently pregnant pregnant within last 4 week Not eligible IUD insertion per PPLM 's clinical protocol Presenting IUD removal reinsertion Any diagnosis chronic pain ( include fibromyalgia , endometriosis , dysmenorrhea , irritable bowel syndrome , interstitial cystitis ) Pain medication take within 12 hour enrollment Misoprostol usage within 24 hour enrollment Any known allergy contraindication nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug ( include active renal disease , active hepatic disease , gastric ulcer disease gastritis , bleed disorder )
